subject: AI
title: Prompt Iteration Workflow
description: A structured process for improving prompts based on real user feedback.

hook.text: A PM changes the system prompt 15 times in a week. Quality goes up, then down, then sideways. No one knows which version was best because nothing was tracked.

buildup.text: Prompt iteration needs a process: (1) Collect failure examples, (2) Hypothesize a prompt fix, (3) Test against eval set, (4) Deploy to canary, (5) Measure, (6) Ship or revert.

discovery.text: Keep a prompt changelog. For each version: what changed, why, what the eval scores were before and after, and whether it was shipped. This history is invaluable.

twist.text: Prompt changes can have unexpected side effects. Fixing one category of errors might introduce new ones. Always run the FULL eval set, not just the cases you're fixing.

climax.text: The best teams iterate weekly: review this week's failures, adjust prompts, run evals, and ship improvements. It's a continuous improvement cycle, not a one-time task.

punchline.text: Prompts are living documents. Iterate with data, not intuition.

quiz.question: Why should you run the full eval set after a prompt change?
options: Because fixing one category of errors might introduce new ones elsewhere
Full eval sets are faster to run
It's not necessary ‚Äî just test the fixed cases
